newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil coffee to see rain, no damaging cold--Somar.
newsitem.headline: Brazil coffee to see rain, no damaging cold--Somar.

text.p: Brazil's coffee regions should see no damaging cold over the next five days, with an approaching air mass prevented from reaching the coffee regions by a stationary cold front, local meteorologists Somar said.
The cold front is forecast to reach north Parana and southwest Sao Paulo state later Thursday, bringing rains of up to 20 millimeters.
Friday, the rainy weather will spread to the rest of Sao Paulo state and the Cerrado and southern growing regions of Minas Gerais stage.

The air mass associated with the cold front will stay in the far south of Brazil and will only cause temperatures to drop to between eight and 12 degrees Celsius in north Parana over the weekend of June 28/29, well above critical levels.
Other coffee regions should see around average temperatures, with no forecasts of frosts for any coffee regions in the next five days, Somar said.
